sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using inverse matrices
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using inverse matrices:
2x + 3y = 8
4x - 5y = -11

Find the values of x and y.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using inverse matrices, we first write the given system in matrix form AX = B, where A is the matrix of coefficients, X is the column matrix of variables (x, y), and B is the column matrix of constants.

A = | 2  3 |
    | 4 -5 |

X = | x |
    | y |

B = |  8  |
    | -11 |

Now, we find the inverse of matrix A. To do this, we first find the determinant of A.

Determinant(A) = (2 * -5) - (3 * 4) = -10 - 12 = -22

Since the determinant is non-zero, the inverse of A exists. Now, we find the inverse of A, denoted as A^(-1).

A^(-1) = (1/Determinant(A)) * adjoint(A)

The adjoint of A is obtained by swapping the diagonal elements and changing the signs of the off-diagonal elements.

Adjoint(A) = | -5 -3 |
             | -4  2 |

Now, we can find A^(-1).

A^(-1) = (1/-22) * | -5 -3 |
                 | -4  2 |

A^(-1) = | 5/22  3/22 |
         | 4/22 -2/22 |

Now, we can find the values of x and y by multiplying A^(-1) with B.

X = A^(-1) * B

| x |   |  5/22  3/22 |   |  8  |
| y | = |  4/22 -2/22 | * | -11 |

Multiplying the matrices, we get:

x = (5/22 * 8) + (3/22 * -11) = 40/22 - 33/22 = 7/22
y = (4/22 * 8) + (-2/22 * -11) = 32/22 + 22/22 = 54/22 = 27/11

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 7/22 and y = 27/11.
